loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang is a 54-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City.  She has 4 children.  Her husband is a gym trainer.  Hang earns a living by running a general store, which they have done for 10 years. She would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as milk, soft drinks and toothpaste.  These will be used to stock her general store.  She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and to attract additional customers.  She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income.  This will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods for her store, such as milk, soft drinks, and toothpaste.

loans.name: José Excequias

texts.es:
José de 39 años, es casado y padre de tres hijos de 10, 3 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, es bachiller no siguió estudiando por la situación económica, pues su papá es pobre y tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a su familia; su esposa se dedica a vender platos típicos.

 José, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tiene 12 años,  con su papá a prendió el trabajo, hoy él agradece  a su padre la enseñanza, pues de esa manera esta sacando su familia a delante; pero desde hace  4 años trabaja cuidando un cañal, su día comienza a las cuatro treinta, mientras su esposa le prepara el desayuno, le ayuda a destusar los elotes para que ella venda por la tarde, elotes, tostadas, papitas etc. luego él se va para el trabajo a las 5:30 AM, camina unos 30 minutos para llegar y regresa a las 6:PM.  

El préstamo sera utilizado, para reparar la casa, pues ya no sirve la lamina que tiene y las paredes son de  adobes y con el agua se están lavando. Con el préstamo comprara, 2 docenas de laminas, 8 polines, 20 bolsas de cemento, una camionada de arena, y lo demás para mano de obra.  


Su sueño en un futuro, es comprar un terreno, porque, en el que hoy vive es de su hermano, su hermano le dio para que construyera la casa, y sueña que sus hijos se gradúen en una carrera universitaria, ya que él no lo logro.
texts.en:
José, 39, is married and the father of three children, ages 10, 3, and 2.  He graduated from high school but didn't continue with his education because his father's poor and he had to work to help his family.  His wife sells traditional food.

José has made a living in agriculture since he was 12.  He learned this job from his father and is grateful to him for it now because he's getting his family ahead.  For four years he has worked taking care of an irrigation channel.

His day begins at 4:30 a.m.  While his wife prepares his breakfast he helps her shuck the corn that she'll sell later in the day with tostadas, potatoes, and so forth.  Then he goes to work for 5:30 a.m., walking some 30 minutes to get there; he returns home at 6 p.m.

He's going to use the loan to repair his house because the metal roofing is no longer good and the adobe walls are washing away from the rain.  With the loan he's going to buy 2 dozen metal sheets, 8 pillars, 20 bags of cement, and a truckload of sand; the rest he'll use to pay for labor.

José dreams of buying a plot of land in the future because where he lives now belongs to his brother, who gave it to him to build a house.  He also dreams of his children graduating from college because he wasn't able to.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labor

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: El  señor  Alejandro tiene 26 años, es soltero y vive en la casa de su mamá. Se dedica al servicio de transporte con una antigüedad de dos años en la empresa de radio taxis "EJECUTIVO" en calidad de propietario de su mismo vehículo, además tiene una segunda actividad económica,  en la que se dedica como propietario al servicio de atención de eventos sociales con vajilla incluida, los  ingresos provenientes de ambas actividades sirven para poder cubrir sus gastos. Actualmente necesita un mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo por ello requiere un crédito de Bs. 10200 para que pueda arreglarlo y quede en buenas condiciones para seguir generando ingresos.
texts.en: Alejandro is twenty-six years old. He is single and lives with his mother. He has been working for two years as a taxi driver for EJECUTIVO, a radio taxi company, as an independent taxicab owner. In addition, he has a second business activity; he is the owner of a catering service that also provides tableware. The income from both activities is used to cover his expenses. Currently, he needs to pay for the maintenance and repair of his taxi; for this reason, he needs a loan of Bs. 10200 to repair his taxi and keep it in good condition in order to continue generating an income.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance and repair of his taxi.

loans.name: Zagiraa

texts.en:
Mr. Zagiraa is 32 years old. He is an experienced driver who runs a taxi service business in Uvs province, Mongolia. He lives with his wife, who is a local school teacher, and his mother in their Ger, a traditional nomadic tent. 

Zagiraa started his business years ago and now already has regular clients and is well-known with his reliable and safe service. He is a hardworking, caring and responsible man who is now in need of 1,200,000 MNT [Mongolian tugriks] to replace his tires into winter tires to secure safety, and to pay his mother's medical fee.

loans.use: to replace his tires into winter tires to secure safety, and to pay his mother's medical fee.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has no children currently in school. For the past five years, Alfred has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which handles general products. 

To help expand his business, Alfred has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used for the expansion of the business by purchasing more items, and will help Alfred to generate greater profits and to increase the family income. Alfred hopes that, in the future, he will be able to own an expanded business with various outlets. 

Alfred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alfred who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand the business by purchasing more items.

loans.name: Farba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Farba, âgé de 36 ans, évolue dans le secteur de l’agriculture depuis plus de 6 ans. Il est marié et père de famille. Pour préparer  la campagne de pastèques, Farba a besoin d’une somme de 150000 CFA pour acheter des semences et démarrer. Il est à sa première expérience de crédit à l’IMCEC et cherche une collaboration durable pour hisser son activité à un niveau plus haut. 
Farba s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille et veille pour que cette dernière soit dans les meilleures conditions. 
Farba désire agrandir son champ et varier ses cultures voire faire des cultures maraichères.
texts.en:
Mr. Farba, age 36, has evolved in the agricultural sector for over six years. He is married and a father.

To prepare for the watermelon season, Farba needs a sum of 150,000 CFA francs to buy seeds and get started. This is his first credit loan with IMCEC and he is seeking a long-term collaboration to lift his business to a higher level.

Farba handles his family's daily expenses and ensures that they have the best living conditions possible.

Farba proposes to increase the size of his field and vary his crops, or even grow market garden crops.

loans.use: buy watermelon seeds to grow and sell when ready

loans.name: Mukundane Group

texts.fr:
Astère fait partie du groupe  Mukundane et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 33 ans et est marié à Emmanuella. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants  âgés de 4 mois à 5 ans, 3 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge son petit frère qui étudie.

Il fait le commerce de restaurant  depuis  9 ans. 

Il est à son septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  de 50kg de riz,130 kg de haricot, et  20 litres d’huile de palme à revendre cuits dans son restaurant, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait acheter une deuxième parcelle  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Astère is part of the Mukundane group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 33 years old and is married to Emmanuella. They have three children aged from four months to five years. Altogether three children attend school, as his little brother is also under his care and goes to school.

He has been in the restaurant business for the past nine years.

This is his seventh credit loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan, he will increase his working capital and buy 50 kilos of rice, 130 kilos of beans and 20 liters of palm oil to resell once cooked in his restaurant, to earn more.

In coming years, he would like to buy a second plot of land and see that his children study.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy 50 kilos of rice, 130 kilos of beans and 20 liters of palm oil for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 45 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing 15,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds.

Helen has been raising pigs for nine years and also earns additional income from jeepney transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en: Linh is a 63-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has three children. Her husband is now retied. Linh earns a living running a general store, which they have done for 10 years. Linh would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as milk and confectionery to stock her general store and to buy food ingredients for making jelly for selling. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that, through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as milk, confectionery and food ingredients for making jelly.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh is a 65-year-old single woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. Anh earns a living running a general store, which she has done for 20 years. Anh would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as sugar, eggs, milk and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that, through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as sugar, eggs, milk and confectionery, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Madame Ama est revendeuse de mèches et produits de beauté depuis 2004. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants de 10 et 05ans scolarisés. Son premier prêt sollicité à WAGES lui permettra d'acheter plus de marchandises afin de répondre aux mieux aux besoins des clients. Elle espère à l'avenir assurer une meilleure éducation à ses enfants tout en gardant son activité pérenne .
texts.en:
Mrs. Ama is a retailer of hair extensions and beauty products since 2004. She is married and the mother of two children aged five and ten years, both of whom attend school.

This first loan requested from WAGES will enable her to buy more goods to better meet the needs of customers.

She hopes in the future to ensure better education for her children while pursuing her sustainable business.

loans.use: buy hair extensions and beauty products

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es: Aracely de 39 años de edad es madre soltera de dos hijos de 16 años y 14 años de edad. Aracely trabaja muy duro para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de antojitos tales como yuca frita,  papas fritas y pastelitos de carne. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y así logra dar a sus hijos lo necesario. Aracely es una mujer muy visionaria y cada día busca oportunidades para sacarles el mejor provecho. Desea reparar el techo de uno de los cuartos de su vivienda ya que se encuentra deteriorada y cuando llueve se filtra el agua. Además, desea construir una fosa séptica para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI y así comprar lámina galvanizada, madera, ladrillo, arena y cemento para reparar el techo del cuarto y construir la fosa séptica lo antes posible.
texts.en: Aracely, who's thirty-nine years old, is a single mother of two children, aged fourteen and sixteen. Aracely works very hard to support her home. For eight years, she has been selling snacks such as fried cassava, french fries, and meat pies. This business is her main source of income, and in this way she's able to provide her children with what's necessary. Aracely is a very visionary woman, and every day she looks to make the most out of her opportunities. She wants to repair the roof of one of her rooms since it's currently dilapidated and it leaks when it rains. In addition, she wants to build a septic tank; for this reason, she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, brick, sand, and cement to repair the roof and build the septic tank as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, brick, sand, and cement to repair her roof and build a septic tank.

loans.name: Akoueba

texts.fr: Âgée de 48ans, Akoueba pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, revend de la viande d'agouti et du lapin au marché. Avec une ancienneté de 25ans dans l'activité, elle sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter plus de viande. Elle espère développer son activité et assurer une meilleure éducation ses enfants de 26 et 12ans.
texts.en:
Akoueba is 48 years old. To contribute to the family's needs, she resells agouti (large rodent) and rabbit meat at the market. With 25 years' experience in the business, she is requesting her first loan to buy more meat.

She hopes to expand her business and provide better education for her children, who are 12 and 26 years old.

loans.use: buy agouti (large rodent) and rabbit meat

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Veuve de 46ans, Yawa a 01 enfant de 12ans scolarisé en charge. Pour subvenir à leurs besoins, elle revend des tubercules à domicile et sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises. C'est en 2002 qu'elle a crée son activité. Le profit l'aidera à assurer une meilleure éducation à son enfant et plus subvenir à leurs besoins.
texts.en:
A 64-year-old widow, Yawa has one 12-year-old child to care for, who attends school.

To meet their needs, she resells tubers from her home and is requesting a first loan to buy more goods. She created her business in 2002.

The profits will help ensure a better education for her child and also help meet their needs.

loans.use: Buy corn and yams

loans.name: Chinh

texts.en: Chinh is a 38-year-old married woman with two children who lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is an embroiderer while Chinh earns a living running a general store, which she has done for 14 years. Chinh would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of stock for her store, such as shampoos, shower creams and softeners. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. The boost to her business will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her general store, such as shampoos, shower creams and softeners

loans.name: Sitheang

texts.en:
Sitheang is a 47-year-old resident of Baray district in the Kampong Thom province of Cambodia, where she farms rice and raises piglets. Thanks to these businesses and her effort, she is able to provide enough for her four children’s needs. She has been running these businesses for more than six years with the full support of her husband.

Sitheang successfully paid off a previous loan with HKL. As this will be her second loan, she will use it to buy piglets and more feed to keep fattening her pigs. When they reach maturity, Sitheang hopes to sell her pigs to the markets or local traders for a good price. In the future, she hopes to save enough to expand her rice farm and enlarge her piggery.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed to keep fattening her pigs.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en: Tuyet, 40, is married with two children and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a mechanic while Tuyet supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business four years ago. Tuyet is requesting a loan to buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods such as soya sauce, fish sauce, eggs, and different kinds of canned food, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her child to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store, such as soya sauce, fish sauce, eggs and various canned goods

loans.name: Argentina

texts.en:
Argentina is 38 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.
Argentina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.
Argentina has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Argentina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Due to the hardships of earning a living, Maricel assisted her husband in managing their corn farming business to ensure a high production. They planned to expand their plantation but they have insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed for corn production. Through this loan, she believes that someday they will improve their corn production and give her family a better way of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed for corn production

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en: Hoang is a 38-year-old man. He has one child. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife have been running a business selling clothing for eight years. Hoang would like to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell in the new year. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his existing customers and attract additional customers. He also hopes that through the loan his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell in the new year

loans.name: Umitker

texts.en:
Umitker is 46-years-old and lives with her four children and husband in a Ger (a Mongolian yurt or circular tent) in the Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. All of her children study at the local high school and primary school.

She started to sell dairy products in 2003. She purchases organic dairy products from herders in the countryside and sells at her rental booth in local market to local residents. She is planning to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products and store them to sell during the winter when the price goes up. 

She is a very optimistic and hard-working woman who says, "I have been taking advantage of Kiva loans at XacBank to run my business successfully as well as support my children's education." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to sell during the winter.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to sell during the winter in her food stall business.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en:
Jumagul is an excellent farmer as well as a good mother to her son. She has been a widow for many years now and began her own business growing crops and vegetables after her husband died because she needed to make money. 
Nowadays she runs her business successfully, growing wheat and potatoes with the help of her son. However, although she works very hard, she receives only a small income. She wants to sow her crops this autumn but she does not have enough money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. Thus, she is asking for a loan of 1000 Tajikistani somoni (TJS) to buy seeds and fertilizers. Jumagul is going to hold a wedding party for her son with the profit and she awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An is from a village in the Baray district of Kampong Thom province, Cambodia. She is 62 years old, married and has four children. To make a living, An raises crops such as rice and cassava. Farming is the sole source of income for her family and she has been doing it for over 20 years, now earning approximately 15,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day.

To help her further develop her farming business, she has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 KHR to hire labourers to work on her cassava plantations. This will be her second loan cycle from HKL. With the income she expects to generate from her current business, she plans to reinvest back into planting cassavas and save for future expansion.

loans.use: to hire labourers to work on her cassava plantations.

loans.name: Zulfugar

texts.en:
Zulfugar is 40 years old. He is married and has two children. His son studies in his first year of college and his daughter goes to 10th class. Maryam is Zulfugar’s wife. She is a housewife and helps Zulfugar in his business. 

Zulfugar’s family have been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Füzuli city already for 20 years and now they live in Ahmadbayli village of Füzuli region. Zulfugar has cows. He sells their milk and milk products (yogurt, cheese, etc.) which are made by Zulfugar and his wife. 

Now Zulfugar wants to build a stall for his cows. Therefore he needs a loan amount of 1700 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He is thankful  to Kiva and Komak for this loan. In the future, to increase his business, Zulfugar wants to buy more cattle.

loans.use: to build a stall for his cows

loans.name: Orange Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her early 40s, is married with five children, two of them are grown-up and the other three are still at school. She has been running several businesses like, a grocery, selling beers, sodas, juice, water, spirits, and selling fish as well as chapati for two and a half years now.  She works from 6.00 am to 9.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mariam's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to restock the missing items in the grocery store, bought more fish and bought baking flour and cooking oil.  She is really doing great and appreciates the loan.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay for school fees and household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase the stock in her grocery and to buy more fish to resell and chapati.  She dreams of building her own house.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group "ORANGE" which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the stock in her grocery and to buy more fish and chapati to resell

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Homme de 42ans, Mr Kodjo pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille(mariée et père de 02 enfants de 16 et  13ans),revend des pièces détachées auto à ses clients. Sa première demande faite à WAGES lui permettra d'acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire les clients. Il souhaite à l’avenir avoir un grand étalage et bien nourrir sa famille.
texts.en:
Kodjo is 42 years old, married, and a father of two children, who are 13 and 16 years old. He supports his family's needs by reselling spare auto parts. 

His first loan with WAGES will allow him to buy more parts in order to satisfy his customers. 

In the future, he would like to have a large area to display his goods and also be able to feed his family well.

loans.use: to buy spare auto parts

loans.name: Agnés

texts.fr: Mère de famille, Agnès pour contribuer aux besoins de cette dernière revend des poissons frais. Elle a démarré en 1995 et s'y plait bien car cela lui permet de mieux s'épanouir. Son premier prêt lui servira à acheter des poissons frais pour satisfaire les besoins des clients. Elle a 49ans et 02 des 03 enfants sont scolarisés. A l'avenir, elle espère avoir plus de client et assurer l'avenir de sa famille.
texts.en:
A mother of a family, Agnes supports her various needs by reselling fresh fish. She started this business in 1995. She is happy with the business, because it allows her to thrive.

Her first loan will be used to buy fresh fish to meet the needs of her customers. 

Agnes is 49 years old, and two of her three children go to school.

In the future, she hopes to have more customers and ensure a future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Quynh

texts.en: Quynh, 28, is single and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She supports her family by running a business selling beauty products and running a motorcycle parking service. Quynh started these businesses ten years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand them by buying a greater variety of beauty products to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She will also use part of her loans to rent additional space to expand her parking service. She hopes her businesses run smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of beauty products for her store and to expand her motorcycle parking service

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga, 28, is married and has a son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband supports the family as a worker in a local factory. She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

Nga started this business four years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to restock her general store.

loans.name: Gor

texts.en:
Gor is 28 years old and he lives in the city of Vedi which is in Ararat region. Gor has graduated Yerevan State Pedagogical University and after his military service, he began working at the local school as a teacher of history;he is also a teacher of social sciences and the history of the church at the school.

 As Gor says, during these years of work at the school with children, he became sure that he has rightly chosen his specialty and he likes it more and more. Together with his work at the school Gor also is engaged in agriculture. He cultivates an apple orchard and manages to sell all the harvest at the city wholesale market. He is not married and he lives with his parents, who greatly help him in his agricultural activities.

Gor is asking for a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams in order to buy some new sorts of apple trees and also he wants to buy tillage (a plot of land) in order to make his orchard and income bigger.

loans.use: To buy new sorts of apple trees and a plot of land to enlarge his orchard

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kigumba in the Hoima region of Uganda. she is a widow and has eight children. For the past three years, Josephine has been working hard to manage her furniture shop, where various furniture types are made.

To help expand her business, Josephine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase  her stock by buying more timber, pine wood and other materials, and will help Josephine to generate greater profits and to have enough supplies for the market. Josephine hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Josephine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Josephine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase her stock by buying more timber, pine wood and other materials

loans.name: Thérese

texts.fr: Revendeuse de haricot à la devanture de son domicile, madame Thérése sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des matières premières( haricot, gari, huile de noix de palme....)entrant dans la préparation.  Elle prévoit ouvrir une boutique et vendre d'autres choses et assurer l'épanouissement de la famille(mariée à un architecte et mère de 06enfants dont 03 scolarisés) Elle même est âgée de 40ans.
texts.en:
Therese sells beans from her home and is seeking her first loan with WAGES to buy basic ingredients (beans, gari [manioc flour], palm oil...), which will be used in the preparation [of the beans].

She plans to open a shop and sell other things and ensure that her family thrives. 

She is 40 years old, is married to an architect, and is a mother of six children, of whom three go to school.

loans.use: to buy basic ingredients (beans, gari [manioc flour], palm oil...)

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est une femme mariée de 56 ans et mère de 4 enfants. Revendeuse de profession, elle est l’épouse d’un agent d’impôts en retraite. Akouvi commercialise des produits d’alimentation générale et est très souvent confrontée à une variation. Elle effectue ses opérations financières avec WAGES et sollicite un second crédit dans le but de s’approvisionner en produits d’alimentation générale et de constituer son stock. Elle espère pouvoir être indépendante et avoir une famille épanouie.
texts.en:
Akouvi is a 56-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is a merchant by profession, and a wife of a retired tax officer. 

Akouvi sells general food products and often faces a fluctuation [in her stock].

She conducts her finances with WAGES and seeks a second loan with the goal of procuring general food products and building up her stock.

She hopes to be able to be (financially) independent and have a thriving family.

loans.use: to buy general food products

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en:
Nhanh, 36, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a shop selling clothes for two years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business activities by opening a general store to sell daily-use and other products to people in her community.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy daily-use items and other products to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Viet

texts.en:
Viet, 50, is married and has two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife works in a beauty salon. Viet has been running a beauty shop and a general store in front of his house for 10 years. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying more different products such as milk, snack, candies and household items to better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions and sending his children to school.

loans.use: To buy milk, snacks, candies and household items to sell at his store.

loans.name: Truong

texts.en:
Truong, 53, is divorced and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income running a store selling electrical products and appliances. She started this business six years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of electrical products to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy and sell electrical goods.

loans.name: Nukri

texts.en:
Nukri, aged 27, is from the village of Kortskheli. He lives with his wife, two toddler children, parents, and retired grandmother. The family runs an agricultural business and breeds three milking cows, three calves, and two pigs. The milk is used in cheese production. Nukri sells the cheese and piglets seasonally. Moreover, the family grows nuts in their own garden. 
  
In order to generate income for the family's well being, Nukri will start a trading business with fruits and vegetables in his district, but he needs a van for making deliveries. With the received loan, Nukri will pay for the van and start selling fresh products. He will also sell his harvest in season and earn an income. Nukri is a very hardworking man, with a great desire to ensure that his family members have proper living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a van to use in his agriculture trading business.

loans.name: Jose Cristobal

texts.es: José es un hombre trabajador y luchador de 53 años de edad, acompañado, con un hijo menor, su negocio es la compra y  venta de calzado desde hace 5 años. Comercializa sus productos ambulantes y en su comunidad. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de zapatos cerrados, sandalias bajas, altas para niños y adultos al por mayor.
texts.en: José is a hard-working man, full of fighting spirit. He is 53 and lives with his partner, with whom he has a son who is still a child. José buys and sells shoes and has been doing so for 5 years, door-to-door in his neighbourhood. He asks for the loan in order to buy shoes and sandals wholesale, both high and low-heeled, for children and adults.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Raquel Eunice

texts.es: Raquel es una mujer emprendedora y exitosa, tiene la edad de 29 años, casada, con un hijo menor bajo su responsabilidad. Su negocio es una sala de belleza desde hace 6 años, tiene a una trabajadora particular  que  atiende junto con ella el salón. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de materiales  de belleza como es tintes, queratina, shampoo profesional, cremas faciales, maquillaje, spray, talco, uñas acrílicas, etc.
texts.en: Raquel is a successful and entrepreneurial 29 year old woman who is married with one child under her care. Her business is a beauty salon which she has had for six years. She has one employee who attends to the salon with her. The loan she is requesting is to buy beauty supplies including dyes, keratin, professional shampoo, facial creams, make-up, hair spray, talc, and acrylic nails.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies including dyes, keratin, professional shampoo, facial creams, make-up, hair spray, talc powder  and acrylic nails.

loans.name: Ukweli Group

texts.fr: La cliente Victorine est une présidente de l’association d’affaire « Ukweli », senior entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 64 ans, veuve et mère de 10 enfants qui sont tous mariés. La cliente est  une vendeuse d’habits (pagnes). Elle installe ses marchandises au long de la rue dans un quartier  animé. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari (alors de son vivant). Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 18 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 12 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite  étendre son projet de commerce et construire une maison  pour ses petits fils. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Victorine is the president of the group "Ukweli". She is dynamic and the most experienced entrepreneur [of the group]. She is 64 years old, widowed, and the mother of 10 children, who are all married.

Victorine sells clothes (pagnes) along a road in a busy area. She started this business with the help of her husband (who was alive at the time). Later, she benefited from a loan from Hekima. She has been in this business now for 18 years.

This new loan will be used to buy 12 pagne outfits.

She hopes to expand her business and also build a house for her grandchildren.

Finally, Victorine wants to strongly thank Hekima for their support to make female entrepreneurs, who cannot access traditional financial services, independent, especially during this critical time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 12 outfits [pagnes]

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Suad

texts.en:
Suad is 24 years old and married, with two children. She lives in Taiz, Yemen. 

She has a house where she tries to raise her children well. Her Husband earns low income, but unfortunately, they are not enough to cover all the family's needs. 

Now, she  is requesting a YER 200,000 loan from AMB to help cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture in order to improve the living conditions in her house. Taking out this loan will allow her and her family to have comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to buy new living room furniture and improve the living conditions in her house.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 28-year-old man who is single and lives in a bad situation in Hodeidah, Yemen. He is very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic and has a great desire to succeed. He owns a house that he inherited from his father. Now, he would like to repair his house but he doesn't have sufficient money. He has applied for a loan of 400,000 YER to buy construction materials to use for his house. He hopes to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for his house.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is 19 years old. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He works hard and has been a butcher for a few months. He is successfully developing his business. He started his business by purchasing goats and sheep. This enabled him to open a small butcher shop. Now he is looking to expand his business selling his products, so he requested a loan of 200,000 Yemeni rials from AMB to buy livestock for his butcher shop. In future, he would like to have a farm of sheep and cows in order to improve his living conditions. His aspiration is to provide his family with the best life.

loans.use: to buy livestock for his butcher shop in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a clever, skillful, and calm 28-year-old man who lives in Ibb, Yemen. He is an amazing person with unusually good humane qualities. He has a huge heart and is a good family man with a loving wife and three children. He wants a good future for his children because he missed the chance to study and receive a higher education. He is a driver getting a low salary. He is trying to do everything he can so that his family will not need for anything.

Inadequate capital and inflation mean he may not achieve the desires he has for his children. He would like to improve his home by buying new furniture and some home appliances. This loan will help him to improve his home and his living conditions.

loans.use: to improve his home by buying new furniture and some home appliances.

loans.name: Gulmaston

texts.ru: Гулмастон 52-летняя замужняя женщина. Она сейчас начинает собственное дело. Гулмастон имеет мастерство и навыки шитья и кройки женских национальных платьев. Она давно мечтала открыть в этом направлении свое дело и сейчас она настроена решительно. Гулмастон имеет собственный начальный капитал в размере 800 долларов, а также имеет старую швейную машинку. Она запрашивает кредит, чтобы купить компьютерную швейную машинку и ткани. Гулмастон планирует в среднем за месяц вышивать по 25 обычных платьев и по 20 платьев с вышивками. Она будет заниматься шитьем у себя дома и ей будет помогать ее невестка. Первыми клиентами Гулмастон будут ее соседи, знакомые и родственники. Она уже верит в успех и прибыльность своего дела.
texts.en:
Gulmaston is a 52 years old, married woman. She is currently starting her own business. Gulmaston has the skills and knowledge of cutting and sewing women's national dresses. She has long dreamed of starting a business in this area and currently she is determined to do it. 

Gulmaston has her own starting capital of 800 US dollar, and also has an old sewing machine. She requests a loan to purchase a digital sewing machine and fabric. Gulmaston plans to sew 25 general dresses and around 20 dresses with embroideries on average each month. She will work with sewing from her house and her daughter-in-law will help her. 

Gulmaston's first customers will be her neighbors, acquaintances and relatives. She believes in success and the profitability of her business.

loans.use: to purchase a digital sewing machine and fabric for starting her own sewing business

loans.name: Buaisha

texts.ru: Буайше 67 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Буайши - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Буайша занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Буайши, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Буайша обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Буайша планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку холодильника.
texts.en:
Buaisha is 67 years old, married and has raised four children together with her husband. Buaisha has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Buaisha works with livestock breeding, after having started 23 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Buaisha's persistent work, her farm currently has two dairy cows, one horse and 10 sheep. The monthly income is 4,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Buaisha turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase cows for increasing the number of livestock. Buaisha plans to invest the income in further increasing the number of household animals, and also plans to save money for purchasing a refrigerator.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Jainagul

texts.ru: Жайнагул 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 сына. У Жайнагул - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жайнагул занимается животноводством, стартовав 31 год назад, с покупки скота на 400 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жайнагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 8 лошадей, 38 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жайнагул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жайнагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Jainagul is 54 years old, married and has a son together with her husband. Jainagul has vocational training. As a main source of income for her family, Jainagul works with livestock breeding, after having started 31 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 400 som (KGS). Thanks to Jainagul's persistent work, her farm currently has four dairy cows, eight horses and 38 sheep. The monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Jainagul turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of sheep to increase the number of livestock. Jainagul plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals. She also plans to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru: Анаре 30 лет, незамужем. В 2011 году, начала бизнес в торговле детскими игрушками на местном рынке, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 40,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Анара имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, она смогла оплатить за обучение в университете. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Анара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для оптовой покупки детских игрушек, для дальнейшей розничной продажи населению. Доходы от кредита Анара планирует вложить в увеличение товарооборота и накопить деньги на покупку дома.
texts.en:
Anara is 30 years old, and not married. In 2011 she started a business of selling children's toys at the local market, using a sum of 40,000 som (KGS) as start-up capital. After expanding her business and finding returning customers, Anara was able to get an average monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her persistent work with the business, she was able to pay for education at the university.

With an aim to further develop and expand her business, Anara turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase children's toys wholesale, in order to consequently sell them to the public as retail goods. Anara plans to invest the income from the loan in increasing her working capital and also to save money for purchasing a house.

loans.use: to purchase toys wholesale for selling at the market

loans.name: Raziya

texts.ru: Разие 55 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 сына. У Разии - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Разия занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 400 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Разии, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 1 теленок, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Разия обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку ягнят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Разия планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en:
Raziya is 55 years old, married and has a son together with her husband. Raziya has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Raziya works with livestock breeding, after having started 23 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 400 som (KGS). Thanks to Raziya's persistent work, her farm currently has one dairy cow, one horse, one calf and 10 sheep. The monthly income is 9,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Raziya turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) to purchase lambs to increase the number of livestock. Raziya plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals, and also plans to save money for building a new house.

loans.use: to purchase lambs

loans.name: Ebrahim

texts.en:
Ebrahim, 27, is a married father of two children who lives in Ibb, Yemen. He fights for his life and for his family. He has a grocery store and has been involved in this business for a few years.

He has been presented with an opportunity to be able to improve his house. This is of great importance to his family, as they will be able to live in better conditions. For this reason, He is requesting a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies so that he can finish building his home. He is grateful to the people who help with this loan and who always think of the poor people and give them opportunities to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies so that he can finish building his home.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 23-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has worked very hard for many years to get his family ahead and give them everything they deserve. He has a grocery store; that is his main source of income. He began his business with too little capital to allow it to run well, and it didn't make much profit at first. Then, he made a plan to develop his business, so he borrowed an extra amount and opened a grocery. Many people prefer his store because he always has the basic staples at accessible prices, and he provides the best possible customer service. His dream is to see his store flourish. Due to the current bad situation in Yemen, he has less profit from his enterprise. Therefore, he took a loan of 150,000 YER to stock his business with more products so that his customers will always find what they need and keep coming back. In the future, He hopes to be able to get his family ahead and give them better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to stock his business with more products so that his customers will always find what they need and keep coming back.

loans.name: Hayam Group

texts.en: Hayam is a group which consists of four ladies who live in Hodeida, Yemen. They have asked for a loan in the amount of 80,000 YER to buy clothes, cosmetics and perfume to resell. Wafa, 29, is a married woman who has two children and lives in Hodeida, Yemen. She has been selling clothes and perfumes for one year to help her family. Now, she would like to expand her business and buy more clothes and cosmetics to target new clients in new areas, so she applied for a loan of YER 20,000. She hopes to have her own clothes and cosmetics store.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and cosmetics to target new clients in new areas.

loans.name: Pinky Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres mujeres emprendedoras una de ellas es Luz una mujer trabajadora de 37 años de edad, casada, se dedica al negocio de la venta de platanitos, quesillos desde hace 15 años. Estos productos los comercializa en su comunidad y alrededores. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año el crédito lo está solicitando para la compra al por mayor de plátanos, aceite, leña, repollo, vinagre, bolsas, para los platanitos y para los quesillos utilizara tortillas, quesillos, crema, cebolla, chile. Carla mujer de 32  años de edad su negocio es la venta de viejitas, rosquillas, empanadas y Vilma tiene 57 años su negocio es la venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three enterprising women.  One of them is Luz, 37, a hardworking woman.  She's married and has made a living for 15 years with her business selling fried plantains and quesillo [soft cheese].  She sells these products in her community and the surrounding areas.

Luz has been a client of the institution for a year.  She's requesting the loan to buy wholesale plantains, oil, firewood, cabbage, vinegar, and bags for the plantains and for the quesillo.  She'll use tortillas, cheese, cream, onion, and chili pepper.

Carla, 32, sells baked goods like viejitas, rosquillas, and empanadas.  Vilma, 57, sells tortillas.

loans.use: to buy plantains, oil, firewood, cabbage, vinegar, and bags

loans.name: Niusy Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socios de negocio uno de ellos es Sayda tiene la edad de 25 años, casada, con dos hijos, bajo su cargo, su negocio es la venta de bisutería  y ropa, estos productos los comercializa en su domicilio y comunidad  desde hace 2 años, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de mercadería como pantalones de mujer, blusas, camisas, brasieres, blúmeres, relojes, aretes, pulseras, colas, prensadores, etc. Yessenia mujer de 31 años de edad su negocio es la venta de ropa usada y Luis tiene la edad de 69 años su negocio es la venta de leña y leche.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three business associates, one of whom is Sayda, 25.  She's married and has two children in her care.  Her business is selling costume jewelry and clothing.  She has sold these products in her home and the community for two years.

Sayda needs the loan to buy merchandise such as women's pants, blouses, shirts, bras, underpants, watches, earrings, bracelets, hair extensions, curling irons, and so forth.

Yessenia, 31, sells used clothing and Luis, 69, sells firewood and milk.

loans.use: to buy clothing, jewelry, and other merchandise

loans.name: Sect 30 Group

texts.fr:
Mme MOUNIRATOU est responsable du groupe SECT 30. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 28ans et le moins âgé a 10ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle a 06personnes en charge.
Mme fait la restauration depuis 12ans. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes  venant des villages environnant. Ses clients sont les enfants, les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 01sac d’haricot, 01bidon d’huile et 01rangée de bois.
Mme veut économiser ses bénéfices dans un compte d’épargne. Elle ambitionne agrandir ses prestations et assurer la scolarité de son enfant.
texts.en: Mouniratou is the leader of the Sect 30 group. She is married and the mother of 3 children, the eldest of whom is 28 years old and the youngest, 10. One of her children attends school and she has 6 dependents. She has been in the catering business for 12 years. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers in the surrounding villages. Her customers are children, men and women. She wants to buy one bag of beans, a can of oil and a rack of wood. She would like to put her profits into a savings account and aims to expand her business and take care of her child's education.

loans.use: to buy a bag of beans, a can of oil and a rack of wood.

loans.name: Lutf

texts.en:
Lutf is a 27-year-old single man. He lives in a poor area in Ibb, Yemen. He has been working in a dental clinic with a monthly salary that he uses to support his family. He works hard daily, and he loves his career. 

He is requesting a loan from AMB to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new laptop. This will enhance his skills in using the computer and speed the process of doing reports for his work, which will ensure better conditions for his work. Lutf appears on the photo with new laptop.

loans.use: to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new laptop.

loans.name: Singuiya Group

texts.fr:
Mme GBOTCHO GERMAINE est responsable du groupe SINGUIYA. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 04 vont à l’école. Elle a 06personnes en charge.
Mme est Gérante de kiosque depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les jeunes du quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter 12chaises et 06tables pour son kiosque.
Mme veut améliorer l’activité avec ses bénéfices et ensuite ouvrir un compte d’épargne. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un dépôt de boissons et envoyer un de ses enfants au Togo pour ses Etudes.
texts.en:
Gbotcho Germaine is the leader of the Singuiya group. She is married and the mother of 4 children, the eldest of whom is 17 years old and the youngest, 3. Four of her children attend school and she had 6 dependents.

Gbotcho Germaine has been running a kiosk for 5 years. She gets her supplies at her local market. Her customers are young people from the neighbourhood. She would like to buy 12 chairs and 6 tables for her kiosk. She wants to use her profits to improve her business and then to open a savings account. She aim to open a drinks warehouse and to send her children to Togo for their education.

loans.use: to buy 12 chairs and 6 tables for her kiosk.

loans.name: Tamba Group

texts.fr:
Mme TENE BERNADETTE est responsable du groupe TAMBA. Mariée, elle est mère de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins âgé a 09ans. 04 vont à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge.
Mme vend de beurre de karité depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les provinces du Burkina. Ses clients sont les fonctionnaires.
Elle veut s’acheter 25plats de beurre de karité.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour s’acheter un vélo. Elle ambitionne aider son mari avec la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Tene Bernadette is the leader of the Tamba group. She is married and the mother of 6 children, the eldest of whom is 21 years old and the youngest, 9. Four of her children attend school and she had 3 more dependents.

Tene Bernadette has been selling shea butter for 10 years. She gets her supplies in the provinces of Burkina. Her customers are officials. She would like to buy 25 pots of shea butter. She wants to use her profits to buy a bicycle. She aims to support her husband with their children's education.

loans.use: to buy 25 pots of shea butter.

loans.name: Ojo De Agua Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socios muy trabajadores uno de ellos es Jader tiene la edad de 39 años, casado, su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos, leña y maíz en su domicilio, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 8 años, quiere invertir en comprar por docenas zapatos, pantalones de mujer, pantalones de varón, blusas, bikinis, bóxer, tobilleras, camisolas, chinelas, camisetas, etc. Jeyssel tiene la edad de 31 años se dedica al negocio de vender tortillas y nacatamales desde hace 4 años, Maricela tiene la edad de 24 años su negocio es la venta de gaseosas, helados y hielo desde hace 1 año.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three very hardworking members, one of whom is Jader, who's 39 years old and married.  His business is selling clothing, shoes, firewood, and corn in his home.  He has been in this business for eight years.

Jader wants to invest in buying shoes by the dozen, women's pants, men's pants, blouses, bikinis, boxer shorts, anklets, athletic shirts, slippers, t-shirts, etc.

Jeyssel, 31, has sold tortillas and nacatamales [Nicaraguan tamales] for four years.  Maricela, 24, has sold soda, ice cream, and ice for one year.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Las Fresitas Group

texts.es: Karla es una de las tres integrantes del grupo tiene la edad de 31 años, está casada, su negocio es la venta de ropa en la zona franca desde hace año y medio. El crédito lo requiere para surtir más su inventario y comprar ropa variada como pantalones de varón, de damas, camisas, camisetas, blusas, shores, zapatos de diferentes estilos, etc. Rosa mujer de 56 años de edad su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva desde hace 5 años y Elida la edad de 22 años, su negocio es la reparación de calzado desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
Karla, 31, is one of the three members of the group.  She's married and her business for the past year and a half has been selling clothing in the free-trade zone.

Karla needs the loan to stock her inventory and buy a variety of clothing such as men's and women's pants, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, shorts, different styles of shoes, etc.

Rosa, 56, has sold new clothing for five years and Elida, 22, has repaired shoes for three years.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 41-year-old married woman from a small village in the Khelvachauri district. She has a large family: husband, three children, and parents-in-law. Her parents-in-law are provided with a retirement pension. 

The main source of income for the family is their agricultural activities. They have a plot of agricultural land where different kinds of fruits and vegetables are grown. They all work hard and always have high quality products, which are sold to local retailers. 

As the income is only seasonal, Marina decided to start a family business with a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $ 3,600 for purchasing a car. After purchasing a car, her husband will start working as a taxi driver and will transport people to generate income. The Start Up program will be a great support for such a large family.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her husband to start taxi business

loans.name: Utulivu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mapendo est une conseillère de l’association d’affaire « Utulivu », senior entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 47 ans, veuve et mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. La cliente est  une vendeuse de denrées alimentaires. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un entrepôt agricole. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari(alors de son vivant). Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 25 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 5 sacs de Soja, 8 sacs de Maïs, 4 sacs d’arachides, 8 sacs de riz. Ainsi, elle souhaite étendre son projet de commerce et construire une maison  pour ses enfants. L’insécurité dans les sites d’approvisionnement est un défi pour l’avancement de ses affaires. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Mapendo, the customer, is an advisor to the "Utulivu" business group. She is a senior entrepreneur with a lot of experience, a dynamic 47-year-old woman who is a widow and the mother of 7 children who all attend school. She sells grocery products. She displays her merchandise in an agricultural warehouse. She started her business with the help of her husband, when he was alive. Later, she benefited from loans from the MFI Hekima. She has been in this line of work for 25 years. This new loan will be used to buy 5 bags of soja beans, 8 bags of maize, 4 bags of groundnuts and 8 bags of rice. She would like to expand her business and build a house for her children. The insecurity in the areas where she gets her supplies presents a challenge to the development of her business. Finally, she would like to strongly thank Hekima for enabling non-bancable women entrepreneurs to be self-sufficient, especially during this critical time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of soja beans, 8 bags of maize, 4 bags of groundnuts and 8 bags of rice.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 12 Juillet 2008 ce groupe au sein du banc villageois compte 05 femmes qui de par leur travail et sérieux ont atteint le second produit qu’offre le programme. Elles ont à leur actif plus de 5 cycles et s’activent principalement dans le petit commerce  petit commerce.

Madame Aminata (debout à droit), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont une fille. C’est une femme très dynamique et s’active dans la vente de tissus teintés, qu’elle achète vers la partie orientale du pays pour la revente à crédit de deux mensualités.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle compte acheter 36 coupons de 5 yards de couleurs différentes à 12 500 FCFA le yard.

Avec les bénéfices elle compte apporter son soutien à ses enfants dans le cadre de leur scolarité.
texts.en:
This group at the center of the "banc villageois" was created on the 12 of July, 2008. It consists of 5 members who, thanks to their hard work and dedication, have reached the second product offered by the program. They have been active for over 5 cycles and are mainly small retailers.

Aminata, standing on the far right in the picture, is the group's featured borrower. She is married and the mother of 3 children, one of whom is a girl. She is a very dynamic woman who sells dyed fabrics which she buys in the east of the country and then resells on two months credit terms. She plans to use her new loan to buy 36 cuttings of 5 yards of different coloured fabrics (at 12 500 francs per yard). She plans to use her profits to cover her children's education needs.

loans.use: to buy 36 cuttings of 5 yards of different coloured fabrics (at 12 500 francs per yard).

loans.name: Khadidiatou Kindy's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 12 Juillet 2008 ce groupe au sein du banc villageois compte 26 femmes qui toutes s’activent dans des activités génératrices de revenu plus particulièrement le petit commerce et la transformation de produits. Elles vivent dans le même village et entretiennent des liens de solidarité très développés.

Madame Khadidiatou  (assise à la troisième position de la gauche vers la droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans, est mariée et mère de trois  enfants dont 02 filles et un garçon. Son activité s’inscrit dans la vente d’encens et de tissus. Pour se faire elle achète les graines d’encens qu’elle mélange avec différents parfums et les gardent enfermés dans des pots en verre pendant quels mois pour obtenir le produit fini.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter en plus de l’encens brut différents parfums pour la fabrication de plusieurs saveurs d’encens.

Les bénéfices de cette activité lui permettront en plus d’apporter son soutien à son mari dans la gestion globale du ménage et  mieux assister ses enfants dans leur scolarité.
texts.en:
This group at the center of the "banc villageois" was created on the 12 of July, 2008. It consists of 36 women who are all either small retailers or producers. They live in the same village and enjoy very well-developed links of solidarity.

Khadidiatou, sitting third from the left in the picture, is the group's featured borrower. She is 37 years old, married and the mother of 3 children; two girls and a boy. She sells incense and fabrics. In order to be able to do this, she buys grains of incense that she mixes with different perfumes and keeps in glass pots for several months in order to get the finished product. Her new loan will allow her to buy raw incense and different perfumes with which to make various flavours of incense. The profits generated by her business will enable her to support her husband more with the general management of the household and to better help her children with their education needs.

loans.use: to buy raw incense and different types of perfume with which to make different flavours of incense.

loans.name: Phuoc

texts.en:
Phuoc, 43, is married and has been supporting his family by operating a metalworking business. He lives with his two sons and wife in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife is a laundry woman.

Phuoc has been in his business for fifteen years. He plans to use this loan to buy a new metalworking machine. In the future, he would like to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new machine for his metalworking business

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh is a 31-year-old divorced woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns a living running a general store, which she have done for 3 years. Hanh would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as sugar, milk and soft drinks, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as sugar, milk and soft drinks, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy, 55, is married and has four children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income by running a general store in front of their house. They started this business ten years ago. Thuy is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular food ingredients such as sugar, salt and seasoning powder, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular food ingredients such as sugar, salt and seasoning powder to stock her store

loans.name: Bonifacia Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Bonifacia tiene la edad de 66 años, casada, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 15 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 6 años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de inventario como es quintal de arroz, azúcar, aceite, cajas de jabón de lavar ropa, jabón de lavar trastes, papel higiénico, gaseosa, chiverías, productos lácteos, etc. Anielka mujer  de 30 años su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosméticos y Tomasita tiene la edad de 56 años su negocio es la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three enterprising members, one of whom is Bonifacia, 66 years old. She is married and has two children. She has had a small convenience store business for 15 years and has been a member of the institution for 6 years. She is requesting this loan to buy inventory including a hundredweight (60 lb.) of rice, sugar, cooking oil, boxes of soap for washing clothes, dishwashing soap, toilet paper, soft drinks, Chiveria products, dairy products, and more.

Anielka, 30, has a business selling clothing and cosmetics and Tomasita, 56, has a business selling clothing.

loans.use: to buy inventory including a hundredweight (60 lb.) of rice, sugar, cooking oil, boxes of soap for washing clothes, dishwashing soap, toilet paper, soft drinks, Chiveria products, dairy products, and more.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
"Bosco is 33-years-old and lives in the town of Kijura in the region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children. For the past 4 years, Bosco has been working hard to manage his hardware shop, which deals in welding. 

To help expand his business, Bosco has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand on his business by moving to a bigger store and buying more machines, and it will help Bosco to generate greater profits and to increase the family income. Bosco hopes that in the future he will be able to own an expanded business. 

Bosco is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Bosco who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans."

loans.use: to expand on his business by moving to a bigger store and buying more machines

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn is 25 years old and has three children. Jeralyn is married and has one child who in school.

Jeralyn is in the agricultural business, buying and selling goats in the Philippines. Jeralyn requested a loan of 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional goats to sell.

Jeralyn has been buying and selling goats for 7 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business..

In the future, Jeralyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goats to sell

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products.
He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and increase sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock his general store.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu, 35, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two sons and her husband. Thu and her husband earn money through their business sewing garments. Thu would like to take out a loan to buy a larger quantity of material so that she and her husband can increase their production and make a higher income to cover their living costs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members – especially her children – will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy a higher quantity of material for making clothes

loans.name: Dios Con Nosotros Group

texts.es: Mireya es una de las cinco integrantes del grupo tiene la edad de 39 años, soltera, tiene un hijo bajo su cargo, se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa y sandalias en su comunidad y alrededores. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 4 años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de inventario como pantalones de damas, pantalones de varón, blusas, camisas, sandalias de plata forma, sandalias baja, camisas sport. Claribel mujer de 36 años su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras, Gilma mujer de 28 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de zermat,  Karla tiene la edad de 32 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de Avon y ropa interior, Meyquelina tiene la edad de  24 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y ropa.
texts.en:
Mireya is one of the five members in this group. She is 39 years old, single, and has a son. She makes a living by selling clothing and sandals in her community and surrounding areas. She has been a member of the institution for four years. She is requesting this loan to buy inventory such as women's pants, men's pants, blouses, shirts, platform sandals, flat sandals, and sports shirts.

Claribel, 36, has a business selling fruits and vegetables. Gilma, 28, has a business selling Zermat cosmetics. Karla, 32, has a business selling Avon cosmetics and undergarments. Meyquelina, 24, has a business selling cosmetics and clothing.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as women's pants, men's pants, blouses, shirts, platform sandals, flat sandals, and sports shirts.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 40 years old and widowed with one son. She supports her family by selling meals in the local community. She would like to borrow a loan to repair her food stall and buy a motorcycle to transport goods to and from the local market and to deliver meals to people in her local community. 
She hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions and set aside some money for saving.

loans.use: to repair her food stall and buy a new motorcycle for her business

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is 37 years old, and is married with two children. Her husband is a salesman. She has been running a food stall/cafe for 10 years. She started this business to cover her expenses, and help raise her child. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Nga is requesting a loan to expand her business by offering more food and many kinds of soft drinks so that she will be able to increase business turnover.

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy food and soft drinks to sell at her store.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.
She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase food and beverages to restock her general store

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is 50 years old and is married with two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have run a grocery store for 15 years. She sells many kinds of vegetables and rice for people in her community. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of vegetables and rice to restock and sell at her store.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and rice to sell at her store.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en: Hiep, 46, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with his family, including three children and his wife. His wife is a worker for a local factory. Hiep earns money through his business of making stainless steel household products. He would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of raw materials to increase his production in order to meet his customers' needs. He also hopes his business will ensure that his family members, and especially his children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy materials to produce stainless steel household items.

loans.name: Aswan Group

texts.en:
Aswan group consists of three women from Aden, Yemen. Aswan, who is a member of this group, is a 37-year-old single woman who works very hard and does her best to cover all the family's needs. 

She became a door-to-door clothes seller. At first, she was selling clothes for others and got money for that. After she had enough experience, she wanted to start her own business. She would like to purchase and resell women's clothes, especially "dera'a" and "jalabiate," which are traditional, light dresses worn mostly in warm areas of Yemen. 

Aswan has requested a loan of 80,000 YER to expand her business to buy clothes. She hopes to earn large profits in order to improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell and to earn more profit so that she can help her family

loans.name: Eco Divino Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socias luchadoras una de ellas es Oneyda tiene la edad de 28 años, casada, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de Avon y Arabela sus productos los comercializa en su comunidad y sus alrededores desde hace 2 años. Solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos como perfumes de varón, perfumes de mujer, lociones, cremas faciales, cremas corporales, pinturas de uñas, maquillajes, etc. Belcky  mujer de 22 años de edad su negocio es la venta de cosméticos desde hace 2 años, Lesbia mujer de 26 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de la zermat desde hace 1 año.
texts.en:
The Eco Divino [Divine Echo] Group consists of three determined women, one of whom is Oneyda. Twenty-eight years old, married, and the mother of two children, Oneyda has sold Avon and Arabela cosmetics in her community and neighboring towns for the past two years. She is applying for a loan to purchase cosmetics, including colognes, perfumes, facial creams, hand and body lotions, nail polish, and make-up. 

The other members of Eco Divino are 22-year-old Belcky and 26-year-old Lesbia. Belcky has also sold cosmetics for two years, while Lesbia has sold Zermat cosmetics for the past year.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, including colognes, perfumes, facial creams, hand and body lotions, nail polish, and make-up.

loans.name: Las Veraniantes Group
